If you'd been near him, you might have noticed his emotional state and wondered if those were tears or raindrops in his eyes. What you couldn't have known, however, was that those tears were tears of relief. A long wait had ended, bringing a sense of reckoning, and now something new could emerge.

If you appreciate Cold War intrigue and masterful prose, you'll find Ilium captivating. I approach truth like a child with jacks, always questioning and skeptical of every story and product. While I don't think assassins lurk on every corner, I no longer feel safe enough to sleep without a gun nearby.

Eighteen years have passed since I left the Cap, and while I have changed, the world remains largely the same. Once you've experienced the spotlight of the third act, you can never truly unsee what you've witnessed.

If you approach Ilium's intriguing opening expecting a typical spy thriller, you might be disappointed. However, if you dive in with an open mind, you may find yourself pleasantly surprised, as I did. Ilium is a spy novel that prioritizes character development and motivation over action-packed thrills.
conclusion: Ilium is a beautifully written spy novel that prioritizes character development and emotional depth over action-packed thrills. While it may subvert expectations for readers seeking a traditional spy thriller, its exquisite prose, Cold War intrigue, and focus on human motivation make it a compelling read.
